Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Icelandic presidential election, businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir was declared the winner, defeating former prime minister Katrin Jakobsdottir (1). The debate schedule for the 2024 presidential election between President Joe Biden and Donald Trump was solidified before Biden dropped out of the race (2). Migration in Iceland is a key issue in the election, with statistics showing a significant number of Icelandic citizens emigrating from the country (3). The 2024 Presidential Primary Delegate Tracker shows Americans heading to primary polls and caucuses to support their preferred candidate (4). Vice President Kamala Harris has been endorsed by President Biden to take his spot as Democratic candidate in the 2024 election (5). Both Senate and House Democrats met to discuss the presidential campaign, with some refusing to say whether they support keeping Biden as the nominee (6). The selection process for presidential candidates and electors in the United States is nonpartisan and devoid of factions (7). Former presidential hopeful Nikki Haley predicted a female president in the 2024 election, either herself or Vice President Harris (8). There are growing calls for President Biden to step aside from the 2024 campaign (9). President Biden and former President Trump participated in their first debate of the 2024 election season in Atlanta (10).

Timeline.Text: Businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir wins the Icelandic presidential election.
President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump participate in the first debate of the 2024 election season.
A growing number of Democrats call on President Joe Biden to step aside from the 2024 campaign.
Both Senate and House Democrats meet to discuss the 2024 presidential campaign.
A meeting of House Democrats takes place to discuss the presidential campaign.
President Joe Biden endorses Vice President Kamala Harris as the Democratic candidate in the 2024 election.
Vice President Kamala Harris heads to her first Democratic rally as the party's presidential candidate.
Americans head to the polls to support their party's presidential candidate in the primary elections.
Statistics show a decrease in Icelandic citizens emigrating from Iceland, possibly due to the upcoming presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Icelandic presidential election (9) will feature eleven candidates (3) and will be held on June 2 (1,2). Businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir was declared the winner (1,2). The election will see current president Luis Abinader stepping down (4) and the potential for former president Donald Trump to run (11). The election has already been overshadowed by the decision of US President Joe Biden to not seek reelection (12, 19). Other notable elections in 2024 include the United States (5,15), Ghana (16), and Indonesia (17).

Timeline.Text: The National Electoral Commission in Iceland announces the three candidates who will run in the 2024 presidential election.
Ghana's ruling New Patriotic Party chooses Vice President Mahamudu Bawumia as its candidate for the 2024 presidential election.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky declares that presidential elections will not be held in Ukraine in 2024.
Katrin Jakobsdottir resigns as prime minister in order to run in the Icelandic presidential election.
Vladimir Putin announces his candidacy for the 2024 Russian presidential election.
The New Indian Express predicts that 2024 will be a decisive year for the United Kingdom.
The National Electoral Commission in Iceland confirms the validity of eleven presidential candidates.
Dominican Republic President Luis Abinader declares himself the winner of the 2024 presidential election.
Businesswoman Halla Tomasdottir is declared the winner of the 2024 Icelandic presidential election.
President Joe Biden announces that he will not seek reelection in the 2024 US presidential election.
The Los Angeles Times reports on campaigns and strategies for the 2024 US presidential election.
Vice President Kamala Harris delivers remarks at a campaign event in Wisconsin, a possible battleground state in the 2024 US presidential election.
President Joe Biden speaks to the nation about his decision not to run for reelection in the 2024 US presidential election.
